clean_text:
Experimental

Materials

All chemicals are analytical grade and used without further purification.

Preparation of [Ni(μ1,3-SCN)2(μ-MPyO)2] n  

Ni(ClO4)2 ⋅6H2O (0.3240g, 8.86×10-4 mol), NaSCN (0.1437g, 1.77×10-3 mol) and 4-methylpyridine N-oxide (0.1934g, 1.77×10-3 mol) were each dissolved in 10mL of methanol and then the three kinds of solution were mixed together. The yellowish single crystals were obtained after the mixed solution was allowed to stand slow evaporation for two weeks at room temperature. Yield: 85%. Anal. Calcd (found) for C8H7N3NiOS2 (Fw: 283.995): C, 33.83(34.15); H, 2.48(2.75); N, 14.80(14.37); Ni, 20.67(19.98). IR(cm-1): 2124 s, 1625 m, 1499 m, 1401 m, 1209 m, 829 m, 762 m.

X-ray crystallographic analysis of the complex

A single crystal of dimensions 0.15×0.12×0.11mm was selected and subsequently glued to the tip of a glass fiber. The determination of the crystal structure at 20°C was carried out on an X-ray diffractometer, Model Bruker Smart-1000 CCD using graphite-monochromatic Mokα radiation (λ =0.71073Å). Corrections for Lp factors were applied and all non-hydrogen atoms were refined with anisotropic thermal parameters. Hydrogen atoms were placed in calculated positions and included in the final cycles of refinement using a riding model. The programs for structure solution and refinement were SHELXS-97 (Sheldrick, 1990) and SHELXL-97 (Sheldrick, 1997), respectively. The crystal belongs to triclinic, space group   P   1   ¯     with a =7.888(2) Å, b =8.103(2) Å, c =9.590(2) Å, α =71.950(3)°, β =77.227(4)°, γ =71.760(3)°, V =548.3(2) Å3, empirical formula C8H7N3NiOS2, molecular weight 283.995, D  c  =1.720g/cm3, F(000)=288, θ range 2.26-25.00°, index ranges -9⩽ h ⩽9, -9⩽ k ⩽9, -6⩽ l ⩽11. A total of 2814 reflections were collected and 1886 were independent (R int =0.0200), of which 1629 observed reflections with I >2σ(I) were used in the succeeding refinement. The final refinement including hydrogen atoms converged to R =0.0359, wR =0.0819, (Δρ)max =0.374e/Å3, (Δρ)min =-0.295e/Å3. The deposition number of the crystal at the CCDC is 260644.
